newsitem.title: USA: Novell confirms job reductions in Europe.
newsitem.headline: Novell confirms job reductions in Europe.

text.p: Novell Inc confirmed Thursday reports that it is cutting its European workforce by 15 percent, or about 50 positions.
"I can confirm that we have announced to our people in Europe a 15 percent reduction in our workforce there," said spokesperson Jonathan Cohen.
The software company, based in Provo, Utah, also said it is assessing its global workforce structure.
"We are in the process of evaluating our business worldwide, including our workforce, but I can't comment any further at this time," Cohen said.
The company is expected to report second quarter results May 28. Cohen declined to comment on whether a more detailed announcement on job cuts would be made at that time.
The European reductions were reported in the Wall Street Journal's electronic edition today.

The trade publication Computer Reseller News, citing unnamed sources within Novell, this week said the company will undertake a 20 percent reduction in its worldwide workforce of 5,800 employees. About 1,150 people will be laid off, it said.
The company's shares were off 1/8 at 7-7/8 in afternoon trading on Nasdaq.
